briefdescription.para: Check whether the given character is a printable ASCII symbol.

detaileddescription.para: This function checks if the character belongs to the range of printable ASCII characters (from 0x20 ' ' to 0x7E '~').

simplesect.para: true if the character is printable ASCII; false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Trim tabulation and spaces from beginning and end of a string.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a string to be trimmed.

simplesect.para: WshShell_Char_t*: Pointer to a trimmed string.

briefdescription.para: Parse a string into space-separated tokens, handling quoted substrings as single tokens.

detaileddescription.para:
This function splits the input string pStr into tokens by replacing spaces with null terminators (\0). Tokens are written as pointers to the beginning of each token into the pArgBuff array. Quoted substrings (enclosed in double quotes "), if any, are treated as a single token. Quotes themselves are removed during parsing. ч
This function modifies the input string in-place. Spaces and quotes are replaced with \0. Escaped or nested quotes are not supported.
Example: Input: "arg1 arg2 \"quoted string" arg3"</tt> Output: <tt>pArgBuff = { "arg1", "arg2", "quoted string", "arg3" }, *pArgNum = 4

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to the null-terminated string to be parsed. Will be modified in-place.
Pointer to a counter that will be set to the number of parsed tokens.
Array of string pointers (tokens). Must be large enough to hold all tokens.
Maximum number of tokens that can be stored in pArgBuff. Excess tokens are discarded.

briefdescription.para: Converts access permission bits to a human-readable string like "rwx".

detaileddescription.para: This function translates access bit flags into a POSIX-style permission string. The result is written into the provided buffer.

The output format is:
'rifWSH_SHELL_OPT_ACCESS_READis set, otherwise'-' -'w'ifWSH_SHELL_OPT_ACCESS_WRITEis set, otherwise'-' -'x'ifWSH_SHELL_OPT_ACCESS_EXECUTEis set, otherwise'-' -'A'ifaccess == WSH_SHELL_OPT_ACCESS_ANY` (optional fourth character)

parameterdescription.para: Buffer to write result to. Must be at least 5 bytes long.

briefdescription.para: Converts group bitmask into symbolic group string (e.g. "*--*", "---*", etc).

detaileddescription.para: Produces a fixed-length string of '*' and '-' characters from highest to lowest group index.

Example for 4 groups:
WSH_SHELL_CMD_GROUP_ADMIN = bit 0 → rightmost char
WSH_SHELL_CMD_GROUP_MANUF = bit 3 → leftmost char

parameterdescription.para: Output buffer (must be at least WSH_SHELL_GROUP_STR_LEN).

briefdescription.para: Applies the PS1 template and generates the final PS1 string.

detaileddescription.para: Expands a predefined PS1 template (WSH_SHELL_PS1_TEMPLATE) into a complete PS1 string, substituting special format specifiers with runtime values like username, device name, and ANSI escape sequences for styling (colors, bold, reset).

Supported format specifiers in the template:
u — current username (from pUser)
d — current device name (from pDevice)
cN — ANSI color code from predefined color map (0 ≤ N ≤ 9)
b — ANSI escape sequence for bold text
r — ANSI escape sequence to reset all styles
Any unknown % sequence is copied verbatim as X.
The output is truncated if it would exceed WSH_SHELL_PS1_MAX_LEN - 1. The result is always null-terminated.

parameterdescription.para: Output buffer for the final PS1 string. Must be at least WSH_SHELL_PS1_MAX_LEN in size.
Pointer to the user name, divice name or other strings.
